SYSTEM.INTRO_TEXT: Dieser Bereich enthält die Grundeinstellungen für {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}}, die für einen Betrieb als Endpunkt benötigt werden.
SYSTEM.HELP_DEVICE_NAME: Der Name zur Identifikation (auch bekannt als 'Hostname') des {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} Gerätes. Besonders wichtig, wenn sich mehr als 1 {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} Gerät im Netzwerk befindet.
SYSTEM.HELP_LANGUAGE: Wähöe die Sprache für diese Oberfläche.
SYSTEM.HELP_TIMEZONE: Wähle die Zeitzone, in der sich {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} befindet.

AUDIO.INTRO_TEXT: Dieser Bereich enthält die Audioeinstellungen für {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}}, die für einen Betrieb als Endpunkt benötigt werden.
AUDIO.HELP_HAT: Wähle den Audio HAT, den {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} nutzen soll.
AUDIO.HELP_DAPM: Enable Dynamic Audio Power Management (ALSA DAPM). This disables the output on certain HAT's (after a time-out) when idling.
AUDIO.HELP_USB: Select to enable USB audio. This can be used in parallel with an Audio HAT.
AUDIO.HELP_USB_FORCE_VOLUME: Select to force USB volume level on startup.
AUDIO.HELP_USB_AUTO_SUSPEND: Enable USB auto suspend. Not all DAC's support this, so be careful!

NETWORK.INTRO_TEXT: This section contains the network settings for {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}}'s network configuration.
NETWORK.HELP_WIRED_CONFIG_METHOD: Select the method for IP address configuration.
NETWORK.HELP_WIRELESS_EXT_ANTENNA: Select to use external WiFi antenna on CM4/5.
NETWORK.HELP_WIRELESS_INTERFACE: Select the WiFi interface you want to use.
NETWORK.HELP_WIRELESS_NETWORK: Select the WiFi network you want to join.
NETWORK.HELP_WIRELESS_PASSWORD: The password (WPA-PSK passphrase) for the wireless network you want to join.

DISPLAY.INTRO_TEXT: This section contains the settings for the Raspberry Pi Touchscreen.
DISPLAY.HELP_ORIENTATION: If the touchscreen is upside-down then rotate it with this option.
DISPLAY.HELP_ROON_DEFAULT_ZONE: Which Roon Zone should the display show, by default. Make sure you type it *exactly* as known in Roon. You can change the zone also directly from the screen.
DISPLAY.HELP_SCROLL_TITLES: Select to enable scrolling for long titles.
DISPLAY.HELP_BLURRED_BACKGROUND: Select to show a blurred background based on the coverart.
DISPLAY.HELP_SCREENSAVER_TIMEOUT: Timeout (in minutes) before the screen shows the clock or blank.
DISPLAY.HELP_SHOW_CLOCK: Select to show a clock  when idling. If this is not set the screen will blank.
DISPLAY.HELP_CLOCK_24HR: Show the time in the 24-hour clock.

REMOTE.INTRO_TEXT: This section contains the settings for a remote control. The type is automatically detected.
REMOTE.HELP_ROON_ZONE: Which Roon Zone should the remote control. Make sure you type it *exactly* as known in Roon.
REMOTE.HELP_FOLLOW_ZONE: Select to 'follow' the zone selected on the display.
REMOTE.WARNING_EXTENSION: Please make sure you enable and pair the RoPieee extension in Roon!

ADVANCED.INTRO_TEXT: This section contains advanced settings. Only change them if you know exactly what you're doing!
ADVANCED.HELP_UPDATE_CHANNEL: The channel {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} uses for its updates. Normally this should be on 'Stable'.
ADVANCED.HELP_AUTO_UPDATE: Enable Auto-Update. This will only work when Reboot Schedule is enabled.
ADVANCED.HELP_REBOOT_SCHEDULE: When do you want {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} to reboot.
ADVANCED.HELP_REBOOT_TIME: When do you want {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} to reboot.
ADVANCED.HELP_WEB_PASSWORD: The password used for authentication of the webpage.
ADVANCED.HELP_LED_FUNCTION: How do you want the LEDs to behave. On the Pi5 the POWER LED is disabled completely.
ADVANCED.HELP_WOL_MACADDR: The MAC address that is being targetted with WoL.
ADVANCED.WOL_MACADDR_PLACEHOLDER: Provide a valid MAC address, e.g. dc:a6:32:ae:8e:7f
ADVANCED.HELP_ALARM_CLOCK: TheAppgineer's Alarm Clock Extension makes it possible to set an alarm for a Roon zone.
ADVANCED.HELP_TOUCHSCREEN_TYPE: Which type of touchscreen is connected.

DEVICES.INTRO_TEXT: Dieser Bereich listet alle erkannten {{.constants.GLOBAL_PROD_NAME}} Geräte in deinem Netzwerk.

DOWN.LINE_1: Dein Gerät startet neu. Es dauert etwa eine Minute, bis die Webseite wieder verfügbar ist.
DOWN.LINE_2: Diese Seite wird automatisch aktualisiert, wenn das Gerät bereit ist.
